In the future, one will obtain the three firm dharmas and retribution.
Be bright and wise,
deeply believe in the Buddha's teachings,
in every place of rebirth,
right views are not obscured.
In the present world,
parents, spouse and children,
relatives and family members,
all flourish.
There will be no disasters or inauspicious events.
In the family,
If there are those who have passed away,
And have fallen into evil paths,
May the blessings bestowed now
Cause them to be reborn in the human realm or heavenly realms, not give rise to wrong views,
And further their merits and virtues.
May they always be able to serve and approach the buddhas and tathāgatas,
Hear the wonderful teachings,
See the truth and attain realization,
And fulfill their wishes.
At that time, after the World-Honored One had finished his blessings,
He then accepted the food. After the meal was finished,

original: 澡漱洗鉢即授商人三歸。
analyzed: 澡漱洗鉢即授商人三歸。
translated: He washed his bowl and immediately bestowed the three refuges upon the merchants:
First, take refuge in the Buddha;
Second, take refuge in the Dharma;
Third, take refuge in the future Sangha.
After bestowing the three refuges,
He then took his leave.
The Sutra of the Wise and Foolish says:
The Buddha was in samādhi for seven days without moving or shaking.
The tree spirit thought, 'The Buddha has newly attained the Way and is wonderful.
He has been sitting for seven days without anyone offering him food.
I shall seek someone to offer food to the Buddha.'
At that time, there were five hundred merchants.
They passed by one side of the mountain.
Their carts and oxen all stumbled and refused to move forward.
Among them were two great men.
One was named Tipura.
The other was named Bhallika.
Out of fear, they returned with the group of people.
They went to the tree spirit and asked for blessings.
The spirit manifested a radiant image and said,

original: 今世有佛在此優留國界尼連禪水邊。
analyzed: 今世有佛在此優留國界尼連禪水邊。
translated: In this world, there is a Buddha now, at the border of the country of Uruvilvā, by the side of the Nairañjanā River.
No one has yet offered him food.
You are fortunate to be able to have a good intention first.
You will surely obtain great blessings.
The merchants heard the Buddha's name.
They all rejoiced and said, The Buddha must be the only great honored one.
He is respected by the celestial spirits, not an ordinary person.

original: 即和󰉓蜜俱詣樹下稽首上佛。
analyzed: 即和󰉓蜜俱詣樹下稽首上佛。
translated: They then mixed flour and honey and went together to the tree, bowed to the Buddha, and offered it to him.
The Buddha thought of the Buddhas of the past.
He pitied the people and accepted their offering according to the Dharma, holding a bowl.

original: 不宜如餘道人手受食也。
analyzed: 不宜如餘道人手受食也。
translated: It was not appropriate to receive food with his hands like other monks.

original: 四天王即遙知佛當用鉢。
analyzed: 四天王即遙知佛當用鉢。
translated: The Four Heavenly Kings immediately knew from afar that the Buddha would need a bowl.
In the time it takes for a person to bend and stretch out their arm,
They all went to Mount Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: 如意所念石中自然出四鉢。
analyzed: 如意所念石中自然出四鉢。
translated: As they wished, four alms bowls naturally appeared from the rock.
Fragrant and clean, without defilement.
The Four Heavenly Kings each took an alms bowl.
They returned together to the Buddha.
They wished that the merchants would obtain great blessings and directions.
There was an iron alms bowl that later disciples would use for eating.
The Buddha thought to take one alms bowl.
It did not please the other kings' intentions.
He then accepted all four alms bowls.
He placed them one on top of the other in his left hand.
He pressed them with his right hand and they merged into one alms bowl.
He made the four edges appear.
He then proceeded on his way.
His demeanor was dignified, his steps like a king of geese.
On the road, he encountered a non-Buddhist named Upatiṣya.
Having seen the Tathāgata's adorned marks,
he praised his extraordinary faculties and peaceful composure.
He then spoke a verse, saying:

original: 世間諸眾生　　皆為三毒縛
analyzed: 世間諸眾生　　皆為三毒縛
translated: All sentient beings in the world are bound by the three poisons.

original: 諸根又輕躁　　馳蕩於外境
analyzed: 諸根又輕躁　　馳蕩於外境
translated: Their faculties are also restless, running wild to external objects.

original: 而今見仁者　　諸根極寂靜
analyzed: 而今見仁者　　諸根極寂靜
translated: But now, seeing you, sir, your faculties are extremely peaceful and still.

original: 必到解脫地　　決定無有疑
analyzed: 必到解脫地　　決定無有疑
translated: Will definitely reach the stage of liberation, without doubt.

original: 仁者所學師　　其姓字何等
analyzed: 仁者所學師　　其姓字何等
translated: What is the name and clan of the teacher you have studied with?
At that time, the World-Honored One replied in verse:

original: 我今已超出　　一切眾生表
analyzed: 我今已超出　　一切眾生表
translated: I have now transcended all beings,

original: 微妙深遠法　　我今已具足
analyzed: 微妙深遠法　　我今已具足
translated: The subtle, profound, and distant Dharma, I have now fully attained.

original: 三毒五欲境　　永斷無餘習
analyzed: 三毒五欲境　　永斷無餘習
translated: The three poisons and the five desires, I have forever severed them without remainder,

original: 如蓮華在水　　不染濁水泥
analyzed: 如蓮華在水　　不染濁水泥
translated: Like a lotus in the water, unstained by muddy water.

original: 自悟八正道　　無師無等侶
analyzed: 自悟八正道　　無師無等侶
translated: I have self-realized the eightfold right path, without a teacher, without an equal.

original: 如清淨智慧　　降伏大力魔
analyzed: 如清淨智慧　　降伏大力魔
translated: With pure wisdom, I have subdued the powerful Mara,

original: 今得成正覺　　堪為天人師
analyzed: 今得成正覺　　堪為天人師
translated: And now I have attained perfect enlightenment, becoming a teacher for gods and humans.

original: 身口意滿足　　故號為牟尼
analyzed: 身口意滿足　　故號為牟尼
translated: My body, speech, and mind are complete, thus I am called the Sage.🔽I wish to go to Varanasi

original: 欲趣波羅柰　　轉甘露法輪
analyzed: 欲趣波羅柰　　轉甘露法輪
translated: To turn the wheel of the sweet dew Dharma,

original: 是天人魔梵　　所可不能轉
analyzed: 是天人魔梵　　所可不能轉
translated: Which neither gods, humans, demons, nor Brahmas can turn.
At that time, Upaka
Heard these verses and was overjoyed.
He joined his palms in respect,
Circumambulated, and left.
Looking back and forth, not seeing him, he left.
At that time, the World-Honored One continued on his way.
Next, he arrived at the side of the Ajāpāla River.
At dusk, he stayed overnight and then entered concentration.
At that time, there was a wind and rain for seven days.
At that time, there was a great dragon king in the water,
named Sāgara. Seeing the Buddha enter concentration,
he immediately coiled his body around him seven times.
After seven days,

original: 時彼龍王化為人形。🔽頭面禮足而白佛言。
analyzed: 時彼龍王化為人形。 頭面禮足而白佛言。
translated: the dragon king transformed into a human form,
bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, and said to him, World-Honored One, during these seven days,
you did not leave and suffered greatly from the wind and rain.
At that time, the World-Honored One replied in verse:

original: 諸天及世人　　所歡五欲樂
analyzed: 諸天及世人　　所歡五欲樂
translated: The five desires that bring joy to the devas and the world,

original: 比我禪定樂　　不可為譬類
analyzed: 比我禪定樂　　不可為譬類
translated: compared to the bliss of my meditation, cannot be compared.
When the dragon king heard this verse of the Buddha,
he was overjoyed, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet,
and returned to his abode.
The Sutra of the Wise and Foolish says:🔽The Buddha was in the country of Magadha.

original: 起到文隣盲龍無提水邊。
analyzed: 起到文隣盲龍無提水邊。
translated: He went to the side of the blind dragon Wenlin's water.
He sat still for seven days without panting or breathing.
The light illuminated the water, and the dragon's eyes opened.
He immediately recognized the Tathagata as before.
The light of the three Buddhas.
The dragon's eyes could see, and the dragon king was delighted.
He bathed in famous incense, sandalwood, and frankincense.
He came out of the water and saw the Buddha's excellent light and shadow.
Like a tree with flowers.
He went around the Buddha seven times.
His body was forty li away from the Buddha's circle.
The dragon had seven heads covering the Buddha above.
He wanted to use it to block mosquitoes, flies, cold, and heat.
It rained for seven days.
The dragon was single-minded, not hungry or thirsty.
After seven days of rain, the Buddha woke up from his concentration.
The dragon transformed into a young monk.
He put on fine clothes and bowed to ask the Buddha.
Did you get cold or hot?
Were you disturbed by mosquitoes and flies?
The Buddha replied at that time:

original: 久得在屏處　　思道其福快
analyzed: 久得在屏處　　思道其福快
translated: For a long time, I have been in a secluded place, contemplating the way, and its blessings are wonderful.

original: 昔所願欲聞　　今已悉知快
analyzed: 昔所願欲聞　　今已悉知快
translated: In the past, I wished to hear it, and now I have heard it all, which is delightful.

original: 不為彼所嬈　　能安眾生快
analyzed: 不為彼所嬈　　能安眾生快
translated: I am not disturbed by them, and I am able to bring peace to sentient beings, which is delightful.

original: 度世三毒滅　　得佛泥洹快
analyzed: 度世三毒滅　　得佛泥洹快
translated: I have crossed the world and extinguished the three poisons, and I have attained the Buddha's nirvana, which is delightful.

original: 生世得覩佛　　聞受經法快
analyzed: 生世得覩佛　　聞受經法快
translated: I was born in the world and saw the Buddha, and I heard and accepted the sutras and Dharma, which is delightful.

original: 得與辟支佛　　真人會亦快
analyzed: 得與辟支佛　　真人會亦快
translated: I was able to meet with pratyekabuddhas and true people, which is also delightful.

original: 不與愚從事　　得離惡人快
analyzed: 不與愚從事　　得離惡人快
translated: I did not associate with fools, and I was able to avoid evil people, which is delightful.

original: 有黠別真偽　　知信正道快
analyzed: 有黠別真偽　　知信正道快
translated: I have discernment and can distinguish true from false, and I know and have faith in the right path, which is delightful.
The Buddha told the dragon king:
You should again take refuge in the Buddha,
take refuge in the Dharma,
and take refuge in the Sangha of bhikshus.
He immediately accepted the three refuges.
Among all the animals,
this dragon was the first to see the Buddha.
At that time, the World-Honored One
then continued on to the country of Varanasi.

original: 至憍陳如摩訶那摩跋波阿捨婆闍跋陀羅闍所止住處。
analyzed: 至憍陳如摩訶那摩跋波阿捨婆闍跋陀羅闍所止住處。
translated: He arrived at the dwelling place of Kaundinya, Mahanaman, Bhadrika, and Gavampati.
At that time, the five people saw the Buddha coming from afar.
They said to each other:

original: 沙門瞿曇棄捨苦行而還。
analyzed: 沙門瞿曇棄捨苦行而還。
translated: The śramaṇa Gautama has abandoned asceticism and returned.
He has given up the pleasure of food and drink.
He no longer has the mind of the Way.

original: 今既來此。🔽我等不須起迎之也。
analyzed: 今既來此。 我等不須起迎之也。
translated: Now that he has come here,🔽we do not need to rise to welcome him.

original: 亦勿作禮敬。🔽問所須為敷坐處。
analyzed: 亦勿作禮敬。 問所須為敷坐處。
translated: We should also not pay homage to him.🔽We should prepare a seat for him if he needs one.
If he wishes to sit, he can do so as he pleases.
After saying this, they fell silent.
At that time, the World-Honored One had already arrived.
The five people did not realize that they each rose from their seats
and bowed in reverence, welcoming him and serving him in turn.

original: 或復有為持衣鉢者。🔽或有取水供盥漱者。
analyzed: 或復有為持衣鉢者。 或有取水供盥漱者。
translated: Some held his robes and alms bowl for him,🔽some fetched water to wash his face and rinse his mouth,
and some washed his feet for him.
Each went against their original vow.
They still called the Buddha Gautama.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Kauṇḍinya,
You all agreed to not rise when you saw me.

original: 今者何故。🔽違先所誓而即驚起。
analyzed: 今者何故。 違先所誓而即驚起。
translated: Why is it now that
you go against your previous vow and immediately rise to serve me?
At that time, the five people heard the Buddha's words.
They deeply felt ashamed and said,
Gautama, have you not become tired from practicing the path?
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the five people,
How can you, towards the unsurpassed Honored One,
use your lofty feelings and call me by my surname?
My mind is like empty space.
I have no discrimination towards any praise or blame.
But you will bring upon yourselves evil retribution due to your arrogance.
It is like a son calling his parents by name.
Even in worldly etiquette, this is still unacceptable.
How much more so for me, who am now the parent of all.
At that time, the five people,
hearing these words, felt even more ashamed.
They said to the Buddha,
We are foolish and ignorant, lacking wisdom and discernment.
We did not know that you had already attained perfect enlightenment.
Why is this?
In the past, we saw the Tathāgata,
practicing austerities for six years, eating only sesame and rice a day.
But now, he has returned to enjoying food and drink.
For this reason, we thought he had not attained the Way.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Kauṇḍinya:
You should not use your limited wisdom to belittle
my attainment or non-attainment of the Way.
Why is it so?
If the body is in suffering, the mind will be disturbed.
If the body is in pleasure, the mind will be attached to it.
Therefore, neither suffering nor pleasure is the cause of the Way.
It is like drilling for fire and pouring water on it.
There will definitely be no light to dispel the darkness.
The drilling of the fire of wisdom is also like this.
If there is the water of suffering and pleasure, the light of wisdom will not arise.
Because it does not arise,
it cannot extinguish the dark obstructions of birth and death.
Now, if one can abandon suffering and pleasure,
and practice the Middle Way, the mind will then be tranquil and still.
One will be able to cultivate the Eightfold Noble Path
and be free from the afflictions of birth, old age, sickness, and death.
I have already followed the practice of the Middle Way

original: 得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
analyzed: 得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translated: and attained supreme, perfect enlightenment.
At that time, the five people,
having heard these words of the Tathāgata,
His mind was filled with great joy and boundless rapture.
He gazed up at the World-Honored One's venerable countenance, never taking his eyes off him for a moment.
At that time, the World-Honored One observed the faculties of the five people,
and found that they were capable of receiving the Way.
He said to them,
Kauṇḍinya,
you should contemplate the suffering of the five aggregates in their entirety.
The suffering of birth, old age, sickness, and death,
the suffering of separation from what one loves, the suffering of encountering what one hates,

analyzed: 所求不得苦。 失榮樂苦。
translated: the suffering of not obtaining what one seeks,🔽the suffering of losing one's glory and pleasures.
Kauṇḍinya,
whether having form or formless,

original: 無足一足二足四足多足。
analyzed: 無足一足二足四足多足。
translated: whether without feet, with one foot, with two feet, with four feet, or with many feet,
all sentient beings,
without exception, have such suffering.
It is like covering fire with ashes.
If it encounters dry grass, it will burn again.
In this way, all suffering has me as its basis.
If there are sentient beings who give rise to the slightest notion of self,
they will again suffer such suffering.
Greed, anger, and delusion,
all arise based on the fundamental self.
Moreover, these three poisons are the causes of all suffering.
Just like seeds that can produce sprouts,
Sentient beings revolve in the three existences because of this.
If one extinguishes the notion of self and greed, hatred, and delusion,
All suffering will also be severed from this.
All are due to the eightfold noble path.
It is like a person pouring water on a raging fire.
All sentient beings.
Those who do not know the root of suffering
All revolve in birth and death.
Kauṇḍinya.
Suffering should be known.
Accumulation should be eliminated.
Extinction should be realized.
The path should be cultivated.
Kauṇḍinya.
I have already known suffering.
I have already eliminated accumulation.
I have already realized extinction.
I have already cultivated the path.

original: 故得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
analyzed: 故得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translated: Therefore, I have attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: 是故汝今應當知苦斷集證滅修道。
analyzed: 是故汝今應當知苦斷集證滅修道。
translated: Therefore, you should now know suffering, eliminate accumulation, realize extinction, and cultivate the path.
If a person does not know the four noble truths,
You should know that this person will not attain liberation.
The four noble truths are true and real.
Suffering is truly suffering.
Accumulation is truly accumulation.
Cessation is truly cessation.
The path is truly the path.
Kauṇḍinya,
Do you understand?

analyzed: 憍陳如言。 解已世尊。
translated: Kauṇḍinya said,🔽I understand, World-Honored One.
I know, World-Honored One.
Because he understood and knew the four truths,
He was called Ājñātakauṇḍinya.

original: 當三轉四諦十二行法輪時。🔽阿若憍陳如於諸法中。
analyzed: 當三轉四諦十二行法輪時。 阿若憍陳如於諸法中。
translated: When the Dharma wheel of the twelve aspects of the four truths was turned three times,🔽Ājñātakauṇḍinya
Far removed from dust and defilements, attained the pure Dharma eye in regard to all dharmas.
At that time,
Eighty koṭīs of nayutas of devas in the sky
Also far removed from dust and defilements, attained the pure Dharma eye.
At that time, the earth spirit saw that the Tathāgata
Was turning the Dharma wheel within his realm,
And with a greatly joyful mind, he cried out,
The Tathāgata is turning the wonderful Dharma wheel here!
The devas in the sky, having heard these words,
And they leaped for joy, shouting to each other,
All the way up to the Akaniṣṭha Heaven.
When the gods heard this, they were overjoyed.
They shouted, saying,

original: 如來今日於波羅柰國鹿野苑中仙人住處。
analyzed: 如來今日於波羅柰國鹿野苑中仙人住處。
translated: Today the Tathāgata, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana in the country of Vārāṇasī,
Turned the great Dharma wheel.

original: 一切世間天人魔梵沙門婆羅門所不能轉。
analyzed: 一切世間天人魔梵沙門婆羅門所不能轉。
translated: No one in the world, whether gods, humans, demons, Brahmā, śramaṇas, or brāhmaṇas, could turn it.
At that time, the great earth shook in eighteen ways.

original: 天龍八部於虛空中作眾妓樂天鼓自鳴。
analyzed: 天龍八部於虛空中作眾妓樂天鼓自鳴。
translated: The eight groups of gods and dragons made various kinds of music in the sky, and the heavenly drums sounded by themselves.
They burned various famous incense and scattered wonderful flowers.
With jeweled banners, canopies, singing, and praises,
The world suddenly became greatly illuminated.
Ājñātakauṇḍinya, among the disciples,
Was the foremost disciple because he first attained enlightenment.
At that time, the four people such as Mahānāman,
Having heard the Buddha turn the Dharma wheel,
And Ājñātakauṇḍinya alone having realized the path,
Thought to themselves,
World-Honored One, if you would further expound the Dharma for us,
we too will be able to awaken to the Way.
Having had this thought,

original: 瞻仰尊顏目不暫捨爾時世尊知四人念。
analyzed: 瞻仰尊顏目不暫捨爾時世尊知四人念。
translated: they gazed up at the World-Honored One's face without blinking for a moment. At that time, the World-Honored One knew the thoughts of the four people
and immediately extensively expounded the Four Truths for them again.
At that time, the four people
also became free from dust and defilements and attained the pure Dharma eye.
Then, the five people, having seen the path,
bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet and said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One,
we five people

original: 已見道跡已證道跡。🔽我等今者。
analyzed: 已見道跡已證道跡。 我等今者。
translated: have already seen the path and have realized the path.
We now wish to leave the household life and cultivate the Way in the Buddha's Dharma.
We only pray that the World-Honored One will compassionately grant permission.
At that time, the World-Honored One
called out to the five people, Welcome, bhikṣus!
Their beards and hair automatically fell out, and kaṣāya robes were placed on their bodies.
They immediately became śramaṇas.
At that time, the World-Honored One asked the five people,
You bhikṣus,
do you know form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness?
Are they permanent or impermanent?
Are they suffering or not suffering?
Are they empty or not empty?
Do they have a self or are they selfless?
At that time, the five bhikṣus,
having heard the Buddha explain the five aggregates,
their defilements ended, their minds were liberated, and they attained the fruit of arhatship.
They then replied,
World-Honored One,
form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness,
are indeed impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: 於是世間始有六阿羅漢。
analyzed: 於是世間始有六阿羅漢。
translated: Thus, in the world, there were now six arhats.
The Buddha and the arhats are the Buddha Jewel.
The Dharma wheel of the Four Noble Truths is the Dharma Jewel.
The five arhats are the Saṃgha Jewel.
In this way, the three jewels of the world are complete.
They are the foremost field of merit for all gods and humans.
At that time, there was the son of an elder,
named Yaśa.
He was intelligent, sharp-witted, and extremely wealthy.

original: 閻浮提中最為第一。🔽服天冠瓔珞。
analyzed: 閻浮提中最為第一。 服天冠瓔珞。
translated: He was the foremost in Jambudvīpa.🔽He wore a heavenly crown and necklaces,
and put on priceless jeweled sandals.
In the middle of the night, he was entertaining with the courtesans.
After the entertainment, they each went back to sleep.
Suddenly waking from sleep, he saw the courtesans,
some lying face down, some sleeping on their backs,
hair disheveled, saliva flowing out,
musical instruments and clothing scattered all over the place.

original: 既見是已生厭離心而自念言。
analyzed: 既見是已生厭離心而自念言。
translated: Having seen this, he gave rise to a mind of disgust and thought to himself,
I am now in this disaster,
in impurity, mistakenly giving rise to the thought of purity.
When he had this thought, by the power of the heavens,
the door of the light in the sky naturally opened.
Following the light, he went to the Deer Park.

original: 路由恒河高聲唱言苦哉苦哉。
analyzed: 路由恒河高聲唱言苦哉苦哉。
translated: Passing through the Ganges River, he cried out loudly, Suffering! Suffering!
The Buddha said, Yasha,
you may come here.
I now have the Dharma of leaving suffering here.
Yasha, having heard this,
took off the jeweled sandals worth a continent of Jambudvipa
and crossed the Ganges River.
He went to where the Buddha was.

original: 見三十二相八十種好願容挺特威德具足。
analyzed: 見三十二相八十種好願容挺特威德具足。
translated: He saw the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks, with a majestic and dignified appearance, endowed with virtue and power.
His mind was greatly delighted and overjoyed, beyond measure.
He prostrated with his whole body and bowed at the Buddha's feet.
He only wished that the World-Honored One would save and deliver him.
The Buddha said:
Excellent, excellent!
Good man!
Listen carefully, listen carefully, and contemplate it well.

original: 如來即便隨順其根而為說法。
analyzed: 如來即便隨順其根而為說法。
translated: The Tathāgata will then speak the Dharma in accordance with his faculties.
Yaśas,

original: 色受想行識無常苦空無我。
analyzed: 色受想行識無常苦空無我。
translated: form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are impermanent, suffering, empty, and non-self.
Do you understand this or not?
At that time, when Yaśas heard these words,
he immediately, regarding all dharmas,
was free from defilements and impurities, and attained the purity of the Dharma eye.
Then the Tathāgata again spoke of the Four Noble Truths,
his defilements ended, his mind was liberated, and he attained mastery of the mind.
He accomplished the fruit of arhatship.
He then replied to the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One,
form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness,
are indeed impermanent, suffering, empty, and non-self.
At that time, the Tathāgata,
Still saw Yasha.
Wearing ornaments on the body.
Then spoke a verse, saying:

original: 雖復處居家　　服寶嚴身具
analyzed: 雖復處居家　　服寶嚴身具
translated: Although dwelling in a household, wearing precious ornaments on the body,

original: 善攝諸情根　　厭離於五欲
analyzed: 善攝諸情根　　厭離於五欲
translated: Well controlling the faculties, being disgusted with the five desires,

original: 若能如此者　　是為真出家
analyzed: 若能如此者　　是為真出家
translated: If one can do this, it is truly leaving the household life.

original: 身雖在曠野　　服食於麁澁
analyzed: 身雖在曠野　　服食於麁澁
translated: Although the body is in the wilderness, wearing coarse and rough clothes,

original: 意猶貪五欲　　是為非出家
analyzed: 意猶貪五欲　　是為非出家
translated: The mind still coveting the five desires, this is not leaving the household life.

original: 一切造善惡　　皆從心想生
analyzed: 一切造善惡　　皆從心想生
translated: All good and evil deeds arise from the mind.

original: 是故真出家　　皆以心為本
analyzed: 是故真出家　　皆以心為本
translated: Therefore, true leaving the household life is based on the mind.
At that time, Yasha,
Having seen the Tathagata speak this verse,
Thought to himself,
The reason the World-Honored One spoke this verse
Is precisely because I am still wearing the seven treasures.
I should now take off these clothes.
Then he bowed at the Buddha's feet and said,
I only wish the World-Honored One would allow me to leave the household life.
The Buddha said, Welcome, bhikshu.
His beard and hair fell out by themselves and the kasaya robe was on his body.
immediately became a śramaṇa.
At that time, Yasha's father,
having arrived at daybreak, searched for Yasha.
not knowing where he was, his mind was greatly distressed.
he wept sorrowfully and searched along the road.
on the bank of the Ganges River, he saw his son's sandals.
he thought to himself,
my son must have gone from here.
he followed the footprints to where the Buddha was.
At that time, the World-Honored One,
knowing that he had come here because of his son,
if he were to immediately see Yasha,
he would certainly experience great suffering or perhaps even die.
he then used his spiritual powers to conceal Yasha's body.
his father then went before the Buddha.
he bowed his head to the Buddha's feet and sat to one side.

according to his faculties, expounded the Dharma for him.

form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness,

then, with regard to all dharmas,

form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness,
are indeed impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self.

having already known that he had seen the path,

He immediately replied, saying:
I have a son named Yaśas.
Last night he suddenly disappeared.
This morning I searched for him
and found his jeweled sandals on the bank of the Ganges River.
I followed his footprints and came here.
At that time, the World-Honored One withdrew his spiritual power,
and the father was then able to see Yaśas.
He was greatly delighted and said to Yaśas:
Excellent, excellent!
This deed of yours is truly wonderful.
You are able to save yourself and also able to save others.
You are here now.
Thus, I was able to come and see the path of the Buddha.
Then, in front of the Buddha, he received the Three Refuges.
At that time, in Jambudvīpa,
Only this elder became an upāsaka.

original: 最初獲得供養三寶。🔽爾時又有耶舍朋類。
analyzed: 最初獲得供養三寶。 爾時又有耶舍朋類。
translated: He was the first to obtain the offering of the Three Jewels.
At that time, there were also fifty elders' sons who were Yéshé's friends.

original: 聞佛出世。🔽又聞耶舍於佛法中。
analyzed: 聞佛出世。 又聞耶舍於佛法中。
translated: They heard that the Buddha had appeared in the world.

Each of them thought to themselves,
In the world now, there is the unsurpassed honored one.
The elder's son Yéshé,
is intelligent, eloquent, and has talents that surpass others.
He was able to abandon his noble clan,
give up the pleasures of the five desires,
destroy his appearance, guard his will, and become an ascetic.
We, now,
what more do we have to be attached to that we do not leave home?
Having had this thought, they went together to where the Buddha was.
Before they arrived, they saw from afar the Tathāgata,
with his extraordinary physical marks and radiant light.
Their minds were greatly delighted and their entire bodies were refreshed.
Their respect and affection increased, and they went to the Buddha.
They joined their palms, circumambulated him, and bowed their heads at his feet.
The elders' sons
had planted roots of virtue in the past, were intelligent, and easily awakened.

original: 如來即便隨其所應而為說法。
analyzed: 如來即便隨其所應而為說法。
translated: The Tathāgata then spoke the Dharma for them according to their capacities.
Good men,

original: 色受想行識無常苦空無我。
analyzed: 色受想行識無常苦空無我。
translated: form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are impermanent, suffering, empty, and non-self.
Do you understand this?

original: 說此語已。🔽諸長者子於諸法中。
analyzed: 說此語已。 諸長者子於諸法中。
translated: After speaking these words,🔽the elders' sons
far removed from dust and defilements, attained the pure Dharma eye with regard to phenomena.
They then replied to the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One,
form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness
are indeed impermanent, suffering, empty, and non-self.
We only wish that the World-Honored One would allow us to go forth.
The Buddha said:
Welcome, bhikṣus!
Their beards and hair automatically fell out, and they donned the kaṣāya robes.

At that time, the World-Honored One
further extensively spoke the four truths for them.
At that time, the fifty bhikṣus exhausted their defilements, their minds were liberated,

original: 爾時始有五十六阿羅漢。
analyzed: 爾時始有五十六阿羅漢。
translated: At that time, there were fifty-six arhats.
At that time, the Tathāgata said to the bhikṣus,
You have accomplished what you had to do.
You are worthy of being the supreme field of merit for the world.
You should each travel to various places to teach and transform.
With a compassionate mind, deliver sentient beings.

original: 我今亦當獨往摩竭提國王舍城中。
analyzed: 我今亦當獨往摩竭提國王舍城中。
translated: I will now also go alone to the city of Rājagṛha in the country of Magadha
to deliver the people. The bhikṣus said,
Excellent, World-Honored One!
At that time, the bhikṣus bowed their heads to his feet,
each carrying their robes and alms bowls, took leave, and departed.
At that time, the World-Honored One
immediately began to contemplate,
What kind of sentient beings should I deliver now?
Who can benefit all humans and gods extensively?

original: 唯有優樓頻螺迦葉兄弟三人。
analyzed: 唯有優樓頻螺迦葉兄弟三人。
translated: There are only the three brothers Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa,
who are studying the path of sages in the country of Magadha.
The king and his ministers and the people all take refuge in them.
Moreover, they are intelligent, sharp-witted, and easy to understand.
However, they are arrogant and difficult to subdue.
I will now go there to liberate them.
Having contemplated this,
he immediately set out from Vārāṇasī,
heading for the country of Magadha.
As the sun was about to set,
he went to the dwelling place of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa.
At that time, Kāśyapa
suddenly saw the Tathāgata's majestic appearance and adornments,
and his heart was filled with great joy. He said,
Young monk, where have you come from?
The Buddha replied,

original: 我從波羅柰國當詣摩竭提。
analyzed: 我從波羅柰國當詣摩竭提。
translated: I am coming from the country of Vārāṇasī and am heading for Magadha.
As the day is already late, I wish to stay the night.
Kāśyapa said again,
It is not at all inconvenient to stay the night.
But all the dwellings are occupied by my disciples.
There is only a stone chamber that is extremely clean,
and my fire-worshiping implements are all in there.
This quiet place can accommodate you.
However, there is a vicious dragon
dwelling inside. I'm afraid it will harm you.
The Buddha replied,
Even if there is a vicious dragon, just let me see it.
Kāśyapa said again,
Their natures are fierce and violent, they will certainly harm each other.
This is not being thrifty.
The Buddha replied again,
But if I see that they can be borrowed, there will certainly be no insult.
Kāśyapa said again,
If you can stay, then do as you please.
The Buddha said, Excellent!
That evening he entered the stone chamber,
Crossed his legs in full lotus position, and entered samādhi.
At that time, the evil dragon,
His poisonous mind turning even more intense, emitted smoke from his entire body.
The World-Honored One then entered the samādhi of fiery light.
The dragon, having seen this,
The flames shot up into the sky and burned the stone chamber.
Kāśyapa's disciples,
Having seen this fire first, returned to report to their teacher,
That young śramaṇa is intelligent and upright,
But now he is being burned and harmed by the dragon's fire.
Kāśyapa was startled awake and saw the dragon's fire,
His heart filled with sorrow.
He then ordered his disciples,
To pour water on it, but the water could not extinguish it.
The fire became even more intense, and the stone chamber was completely melted.
At that time, the World-Honored One
did not move his body or mind, and his countenance remained serene.
He subdued that evil dragon, making it lose its poison.
He bestowed the Three Refuges and placed it in his alms bowl.
By the time it was daybreak,
Kāśyapa and his disciples all went to where the Buddha was.
The young śramaṇa's dragon fire is fierce.
Will he not be harmed by this?
The śramaṇa borrowed the cave.

original: 我昨所以不相與者正為此耳。
analyzed: 我昨所以不相與者正為此耳。
translated: The reason I did not give it to him yesterday was precisely for this.
The Buddha said,
I am internally pure.
I will never be harmed by external calamities.
That poisonous dragon is now in the alms bowl.
He then lifted the bowl to show Kāśyapa.
Kāśyapa and his disciples
saw that the śramaṇa was not burned by the fire,
and he had subdued the evil dragon and placed it in the alms bowl.
They marveled at this unprecedented event.
He said to his disciples,
Although the young śramaṇa has spiritual powers,
nevertheless, my Way is still true.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Kāśyapa:
I now wish to stay here.
Kāśyapa replied:
Excellent, as you wish.
At that time, the Tathāgata
sat under a tree on the second night.

original: 時四天王夜來佛所而共聽法。
analyzed: 時四天王夜來佛所而共聽法。
translated: At that time, the Four Heavenly Kings came to the Buddha at night to listen to the Dharma.
Each emitted light that surpassed the sun and moon.
Kāśyapa got up at night
and saw the heavenly light by the Tathāgata's side.
He said to his disciples:
The young śramaṇa also serves fire.
The next morning, he went to where the Buddha was
and asked:
Śramaṇa, do you serve fire?
The Buddha said, No.
There were the Four Heavenly Kings
who came at night to listen to the Dharma. That was their light.
Thereupon, Kāśyapa said to his disciples:
The young śramaṇa has great spiritual powers.
However, my way is still true.
On the third night,
Śakra, Lord of the Devas, came down to listen to the Dharma.
Emitting a great light like the rising sun.
The disciples of Kāśyapa,
Seeing the heavenly light beside the Tathāgata from afar,
Said to their teacher,
The young śramaṇa must be performing fire rituals.
On the following morning, they went to where the Buddha was
And asked the śramaṇa,
You must be performing fire rituals.
The Buddha said, No.
Śakra Devānām-Indra came down to listen to the Dharma.
That was his light.
At that time, Kāśyapa said to his disciples,
Although the young śramaṇa has great spiritual virtue,
He is still not as true as my Way.
On the fourth night,
Mahābrahmā came down to listen to the Dharma.
Emitting a great light like the sun at noon,

original: 迦葉夜起見有光明在如來側。
analyzed: 迦葉夜起見有光明在如來側。
translated: Kāśyapa got up at night and saw the light beside the Tathāgata.
The śramaṇa must definitely be performing fire rituals.
The next day, he asked the Buddha,
You must be performing fire rituals.
The Buddha said, No.
Mahābrahmā came down to listen to the Dharma at night.
That was his light.
At that time, Kāśyapa thought to himself:
Although this young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually wondrous,
he is still not as true as my path.
At that time, Kāśyapa's five hundred disciples
each served three fires.
In the early morning, they all wanted to light the fires,
but the fires would not light.
They all went to Kāśyapa and told him about this matter in detail.
When Kāśyapa heard this, he thought to himself:
This must be the doing of the śramaṇa.
He then went with his disciples to where the Buddha was
and said to the Buddha:
My disciples each serve three fires.
In the morning, we wanted to light them, but the fires would not light.
The Buddha then replied:
You may go back and the fires will light themselves.
Kāśyapa then went back and saw that the fires had already lit.
He thought to himself:
Although this young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually wondrous,
he is still not as true as my path.
After the assembly of disciples had finished making offerings to the fire,
they wanted to extinguish it but could not do so.
He then told Kāśyapa in detail about this matter.
When Kāśyapa heard this, he thought to himself,
This must also be the doing of the śramaṇa.
He then came to where the Buddha was, together with his disciples.
And he said to the Buddha,
My disciples,
in the morning wanted to extinguish the fire but it would not go out.
The Buddha then replied,
You may return, and the fire will go out by itself.
Kāśyapa then returned and saw that the fire had already gone out.
He thought to himself,
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually profound,
nevertheless, my Way is still true.
At that time, Kāśyapa himself served three fires.
In the morning, he wanted to light the fire but it would not light.
He then thought to himself,
This must be the doing of the śramaṇa again.
He then went to where the Buddha was and said to the Buddha,
In the morning, I tried to light the fire but it would not light.
The Buddha then replied,
You may return, and the fire will light by itself.
Kāśyapa then returned and saw that the fire had already lit.
He thought to himself:
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually profound,
he is still not as true as my path.
At that time, after Kāśyapa had made offerings to the fire,
he wanted to extinguish it but could not.
He thought to himself:
This must be the doing of the śramaṇa.
He then went to where the Buddha was and said to the Buddha:
I lit the fire this morning.
Now I want to extinguish it but it will not go out.
The Buddha replied:
You may go back and the fire will naturally go out.
Kāśyapa then returned and saw that the fire had already gone out.
He thought to himself:
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually profound,
he is still not as true as my path.
The Sutra of the Wise and Foolish says:
Kāśyapa thought again:
This great śramaṇa is indeed spiritually powerful,
but he has not yet attained the Way.
He is not as good as my attainment of arhatship.
At that time, the disciples of Kāśyapa
could not lift their axes to chop wood in the morning.
He then told Kāśyapa in detail about this matter.
When Kāśyapa heard this, he thought to himself,
This must be the doing of that śramaṇa again.
He then went with his disciples to where the Buddha was.
And he said to the Buddha,

original: 我諸弟子晨朝破薪斧不肯舉。
analyzed: 我諸弟子晨朝破薪斧不肯舉。
translated: My disciples tried to split wood in the morning, but the axes would not lift.
The Buddha then replied,
You may return, and the axes will lift themselves.
Kāśyapa then went back,
and saw that all the disciples' axes could be lifted.
He thought to himself,
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually powerful,
nevertheless, my Way is still true.
The disciples of Kāśyapa,
having been able to lift the axes, now refused to put them down again.
They went back to Kāśyapa and told him in detail about this matter.
When Kāśyapa heard this, he thought to himself,
This must be the doing of that śramaṇa again.
He then went with his disciples to where the Buddha was.
And he said to the Buddha,
My disciples wanted to split wood in the morning,
and although the axes could be lifted, they would not go down again.
The Buddha then replied,
You may go back and the axe will fall.
Kāśyapa returned home,
and saw that the axes of his disciples had all fallen.
He thought to himself,
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually powerful,

original: 然故不如我道真也。🔽爾時迦葉於晨朝時。
analyzed: 然故不如我道真也。 爾時迦葉於晨朝時。
translated: he is still not as true as my path.🔽At that time, in the morning,
Kāśyapa himself wanted to split firewood, but the axe would not lift.
He thought to himself,
This must also be the doing of the śramaṇa.
He went to where the Buddha was and said to the Buddha,
In the morning, when I wanted to split firewood, the axe would not lift.

You may go back and the axe will lift by itself.
When Kāśyapa returned, the axe immediately lifted.
He thought to himself,
Although the young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually powerful,

Although this young śramaṇa is indeed spiritually powerful,

Kāśyapa, knowing that the Buddha had accepted,

original: 即勅日日辦好飲食并施床座。
analyzed: 即勅日日辦好飲食并施床座。
translated: He then ordered that good food be prepared every day, along with bedding and seats.

but the Buddha said,

in an instant,
the World-Honored One went to the border of the Jambudvīpa continent.
He picked a nyagrodha fruit and filled his bowl with it.
Before Kāśyapa arrived, the Buddha had already reached there.

he immediately asked,
Young śramaṇa,

original: 從何道來而先至此。🔽佛以鉢中。
analyzed: 從何道來而先至此。 佛以鉢中。
translated: from which path did you come and arrive here first?🔽The Buddha took a nyagrodha fruit

Going south from here,
for many thousands of yojanas,
there is an island.
On it there is a tree
called nyagrodha.
Because of this tree,
it is called Jambudvīpa.
This fruit in my bowl is from there.
In the time it takes to think of it, I have picked this fruit and brought it here.
It is extremely fragrant and delicious. You can eat it.
Then Kāśyapa thought to himself,
That path is extremely long and far from here,
yet this śramaṇa
You were able to return in an instant.
Your spiritual powers and transformations are indeed swift.
However, my Way is still true.
The Sutra of Universal Radiance says:
As soon as Kāśyapa left,
the Buddha used his spiritual powers to ascend to the Heaven of the Thirty-three and
